content:
• Friday, December 16, 2011
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) ends the day at $9.50 - down 5% from its $10 IPO price, and a level that...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) ends the day at $9.50 - down 5% from its $10 IPO price, and a level that puts the net worth of lightning-rod CEO Mark Pincus below $1B. For now at least, Sterne Agee's pre-IPO report is looking smart. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 19 Comments
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +5.1%) rallies, and Tudou (TUDO -1.2%) slumps, after the former sues the latter...

    Youku.com (YOKU +5.1%) rallies, and Tudou (TUDO -1.2%) slumps, after the former sues the latter for patent infringement, adding to a bitter rivalry between the top Chinese video sites. Tudou, for its part, has accused Youku of enabling the piracy of a TV show for which Tudou has exclusive streaming rights; Youku has reponded by accusing Tudou of doing the same thing, only with dozens of different shows.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • STT

    UBS names State Street (STT +2.4%) as its top pick in its trust bank coverage, starting coverage...

    UBS names State Street (STT +2.4%) as its top pick in its trust bank coverage, starting coverage with a Buy rating and $46 price target. STT has more near-term positive catalysts and is best-positioned among the group to withstand the current environment, UBS says. Also initiated at Buy: USB, BBT, STI.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • DAL

    Delta Airlines (DAL +5.1%) joins a broader rally in airline stocks (FAA +2.8%) after announcing...

    Delta Airlines (DAL +5.1%) joins a broader rally in airline stocks (FAA +2.8%) after announcing a major expansion of its flight offerings for its LaGuardia Airport hub, the fruits of a slot swap with US Airways (LCC). Total flights out of LaGuardia will increase by 60%, with many of the new routes targeting the hubs of rival carriers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +22.6%) skyrockets after Diamond Offshore (NYSE:DO) discloses in an 8-K that...

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +22.6%) skyrockets after Diamond Offshore (NYSE:DO) discloses in an 8-K that Cobalt has extended a $360K/day lease for Diamond's Ocean Confidence oil rig. The rig is being used to search for crude oil in Angolan waters.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • ZQK

    Shares of Quiksilver (ZQK +11.4%) pop today in response to yesterday's after hours FQ4 earnings...

    Shares of Quiksilver (ZQK +11.4%) pop today in response to yesterday's after hours FQ4 earnings release that beat revenue expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • DEER

    After crashing in the final minutes of trading yesterday afternoon, Chinese kitchen appliance...

    After crashing in the final minutes of trading yesterday afternoon, Chinese kitchen appliance maker Deer Consumer (OTC:DEER +20.7%) has rebounded after issuing a PR in which it reaffirms its 2011 guidance, and states yesterday's crash was due to "the spreading of false market rumors" by an unnamed "distressed online blogger." Alfred Little has made critical comments about Deer in the past (I, II). (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ITMN

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -12.5%) add to yesterday's selloff after the Institute for Quality and...

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -12.5%) add to yesterday's selloff after the Institute for Quality and Efficiency in Health Care concluded that no additional benefit could be found for its idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis drug Esbriet, also known as pirfenidone.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • RDSMY

    Kensey Nash (KNSY -22%) tanks hard, hitting fresh year lows after saying it is lowering its...

    Kensey Nash (KNSY -22%) tanks hard, hitting fresh year lows after saying it is lowering its guidance due to a dispute with St Jude Medical (STJ -1.8%) over royalty rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • ADBE

    Investors heartened by Adobe's (ADBE +6.5%) FQ4 beat and better-than-feared FQ1 guidance are...

    Investors heartened by Adobe's (ADBE +6.5%) FQ4 beat and better-than-feared FQ1 guidance are bidding shares higher. The graphics/publishing software giant used its earnings call to trumpet its embrace of subscription-based software, and note a cloud version of its flagship Creative Suite will arrive in FQ2. Adobe also disclosed it paid $400M to acquire online advertising startup Efficient Frontier.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    TheStreet.com calls Best Buy's (BBY -0.2%) big bet on heavy discounting that led to a lackluster...

    TheStreet.com calls Best Buy's (BBY -0.2%) big bet on heavy discounting that led to a lackluster FQ3 the "#3 Dumbest Thing on Wall Street" (video) in its weekly ranking of corporate misfires. Gregg Greenberg says the firm needs to come up with a new plan other than out-of-control discounting, a view seemingly held by investors who sold off shares to the tune of 17% for the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +7.1%) shoots higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Overweight, based on...

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +7.1%) shoots higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Overweight, based on valuation supported by a ~$9/share NAV for its Jubilee Field alone. The stock's $21 value estimate also includes appraisal drilling in Ghana and future exploration potential in Ghana, Cameroon and Morocco.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (JAG +7.3%), which fell on Wednesday following its CEO's unexpected resignation,...

    Jaguar Mining (JAG +7.3%), which fell on Wednesday following its CEO's unexpected resignation, is rallying today after issuing an update regarding its strategic review. The update suggests the company is open to selling itself, but doesn't provide any guarantees. Chinese miner Shandong Gold offered to buy Jaguar for $9.30/share in November.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +4.6%) jumps after Miller Tabak upgraded the shares to Buy on...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +4.6%) jumps after Miller Tabak upgraded the shares to Buy on valuation. The firms says the stock has fallen over 15% since this summer due to concern over the price of chicken wings, and thinks the selloff is unwarranted. The company should capture 20% earnings growth through 2013 and sales growth in the high teens.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ACN

    Accenture (ACN -4.8%) is selling off post-earnings, as soft FQ2 guidance overshadows its FQ1...

    Accenture (ACN -4.8%) is selling off post-earnings, as soft FQ2 guidance overshadows its FQ1 beat. Earnings call comments about uncertain eurozone demand could also be weighing on shares. However, Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan both think Accenture is being conservative with its guidance. Rival IBM is down 1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • HFC

    Citigroup initiates coverage on HollyFrontier (HFC +2.9%) with a resounding Buy rating and $25...

    Citigroup initiates coverage on HollyFrontier (HFC +2.9%) with a resounding Buy rating and $25 price target. Analysts with the firm say the refiner is well-positioned in the interior of the U.S. to take advantage of excess supply of feedstocks and short supply petroleum products. Anticipated special dividends from HFC of between $2-$4 are also drawing notice.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CALL

    MagicJack (CALL +17.7%), maker of the heavily advertised device that routes low-cost phone calls...

    MagicJack (CALL +17.7%), maker of the heavily advertised device that routes low-cost phone calls over the internet, cancels a planned stock offering because sales of a new model are expected to fill its coffers. The company says it sold a record 365,000 of its new MagicJack Plus in the last 30 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • ANDE

    Andersons (ANDE +1.5%) gains after announcing earlier today that its board has approved a $0.04...

    Andersons (ANDE +1.5%) gains after announcing earlier today that its board has approved a $0.04 increase to its Q1 2012 dividend to $0.15 per share, representing a 36% increase from Q4 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +1%) trades higher as KeyBanc initiates coverage with a Buy. KeyBanc says...

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +1%) trades higher as KeyBanc initiates coverage with a Buy. KeyBanc says the company is the only publicly traded "pure-play" metallurgical coke producer in the U.S., and is a unique defensive growth play in a mature domestic steel sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • TCPTF

    Canadian miner Thompson Creek Metals (TC +1.5%) moves up after being upgraded to Overweight at...

    Canadian miner Thompson Creek Metals (TC +1.5%) moves up after being upgraded to Overweight at JP Morgan. saying the stock is poised to move higher, now that its funding issues have been removed due to its deal with Royal Gold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • AFSI

    Amtrust Financial Services (AFSI -9.7%) declines after the firm announces pricing on $175M of...

    Amtrust Financial Services (AFSI -9.7%) declines after the firm announces pricing on $175M of its convertible senior notes. The firm expects to realize proceeds of close to $169M from the sale, which will be applied to general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • VOC

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC +3.5%) moves up after Baird ups the shares to Outperform, citing the...

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC +3.5%) moves up after Baird ups the shares to Outperform, citing the company's relative valuation and its heavier oil weighting compared to its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • PIR

    Pier 1 (PIR +3%) gains after Credit Suisse ups estimates on the stock, saying its Q3 results...

    Pier 1 (PIR +3%) gains after Credit Suisse ups estimates on the stock, saying its Q3 results were strong despite increasing fixed costs and the company has strong execution across all business lines. It raises its FY12 EPS estimate to $0.92 from $0.78, and ups its price target to $15 from $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (LLTC +1.5%) moves up after Oppenheimer upgrades to Outperform, as a...

    Linear Technology (LLTC +1.5%) moves up after Oppenheimer upgrades to Outperform, as a “broad inventory re-stock” in the first half of next year “will breathe fresh life” into shares. LLTC was one of the first firms to identify and react to the chip slowdown, but "order patterns have since stabilized, as the channel continues working inventories ever leaner - a classic over-correction."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIR

    AAR Corp. (AIR +5.9%) FQ2 misses on a per share basis but beat on revenue, as double-digit sales...

    AAR Corp. (AIR +5.9%) FQ2 misses on a per share basis but beat on revenue, as double-digit sales gains outweighed higher operating costs in its supply chain business. Its defense-services unit also posted solid revenue gains, largely due to its acquisition of Aviation Worldwide Services last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +1.9%) is outperforming today, while the opposite holds for Seagate (STX...

    Western Digital (WDC +1.9%) is outperforming today, while the opposite holds for Seagate (STX -1.1%), as well as solid-state drive vendors OCZ (OCZ -1.2%) and STEC (STEC -0.7%). The culprit could be remarks from circuit board maker GBM about hard drive supply shortages likely easing in Q1, ahead of expectations. Western Digital's lost production is heavily responsible for the shortages.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +4.7%) moves up after announcing a $50M buyback of its ADR's,...

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +4.7%) moves up after announcing a $50M buyback of its ADR's, coming on the heels of another repurchase plan unveiled earlier this year. The company says it will fund the buyback with cash on hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • NAGS

    Natural gas futures hit their lowest level in more than two years in early trading before...

    Natural gas futures hit their lowest level in more than two years in early trading before recovering a bit, as a near-term forecast for mild weather looks set to continue. Analysts say the $3 barrier could be breached with production still strong and demand tepid. "It's winter and we're not seeing winter-like temperatures." The NAGS natural gas ETF is -0.7%, extending its 3-month 36% decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • FRO

    Shares of Frontline (FRO +4%) stage an impressive reversal, after being down as much as 8% in...

    Shares of Frontline (FRO +4%) stage an impressive reversal, after being down as much as 8% in the premarket following the company's earlier announcement of a private placement.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • CVC

    Cablevision (CVC -15.2%) shares continue their descent in the wake of the surprise resignation...

    Cablevision (CVC -15.2%) shares continue their descent in the wake of the surprise resignation of COO Tom Rutledge. No cable company was "as exposed to key-man risk as Cablevision," Bernstein's Craig Moffett writes, hailing Rutledge as "the hands-down best executive in the industry." The news is a particular concern given CVC's operational challenges in recent quarters, Wells Fargo says. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Not supposed to happen this way - after making its first prints above $11, Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA)...

    Not supposed to happen this way - after making its first prints above $11, Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) dives down below its $10 IPO price, hitting $9.76.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 6 Comments
  • BHC

    The board of ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA +68.1%) confirms that it rejected Valeant...

    The board of ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA +68.1%) confirms that it rejected Valeant Pharmaceuticals' (VRX -0.5%) offer of $6.50/share, calling it "grossly inadequate."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) shares have begun trading. After opening at $11, shares are currently...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) shares have begun trading. After opening at $11, shares are currently changing hands at $11.04, up 10.4% from the company's $10 IPO price. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion's (RIMM -10.8%) co-CEOs are cutting their salaries to $1? "You get what you...

    Research In Motion's (RIMM -10.8%) co-CEOs are cutting their salaries to $1? "You get what you pay for," deadpans Larry Dignan, before proceeding to skewer their latest earnings call promises of a pending revival. Expect disgruntled activist investors (I, II) to gain more supporters following RIM's latest stumble. Meanwhile, Nomura thinks shares may need to fall below $10 in order to draw M&A interest. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • SSKN

    MELA Sciences (MELA -11.8%) says its 5M share secondary placement priced at $3.25, an 18%...

    MELA Sciences (MELA -11.8%) says its 5M share secondary placement priced at $3.25, an 18% discount to Thursday's close. The medical-device maker is seeking to raise funds to bring MelaFind, its tool for melanoma skin cancer detection, to market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • STLD

    Shares of Steel Dynamics (STLD +2.9%) rise despite issuing downward guidance. This morning, the...

    Shares of Steel Dynamics (STLD +2.9%) rise despite issuing downward guidance. This morning, the company said it expects Q4 EPS of $0.08-$0.12, well below $0.18 consensus, and estimated a 25% drop in Q4 flat rolled earnings. Increases in order entry and pricing will not materially impact Q4 but are expected to benefit in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • GRO

    Shares of Agria (GRO +34.4%) skyrocket on volume 10X normal trading activity after the...

    Shares of Agria (GRO +34.4%) skyrocket on volume 10X normal trading activity after the China-based agriculture company reports strong six-month results including a 182% increase in its seeds business primed by higher average selling prices and increased sales volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • GILD

    JPMorgan weighs in on the Gilead Sciences (GILD -1.1%)-Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -2.3%) merger...

    JPMorgan weighs in on the Gilead Sciences (GILD -1.1%)-Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -2.3%) merger after Pharmasset amended its phase 2b quantum trails this morning, rocking the boat of hepatitis C-related companies. "This announcement does not trigger a 'key product event' of the merger agreement. As such, we anticipate the deal will close on schedule."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • CNC

    Centene (CNC +8.1%) rallies after issuing financial guidance for FY12 above the standing...

    Centene (CNC +8.1%) rallies after issuing financial guidance for FY12 above the standing estimate of analysts. The firm sees EPS falling in a range of $2.60-$2.80 on premium and service revenue of $7.2B-$7.6B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • MTZ

    Shares of MasTec (MTZ +7%) take a turn north after announcing it tacks on $75M to its stock...

    Shares of MasTec (MTZ +7%) take a turn north after announcing it tacks on $75M to its stock repurchase program. The addition brings the firm's authorization to purchase shares up to $150M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • GILD

    Following news that Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -3.4%) will discontinue Phase 2b trials of its...

    Following news that Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -3.4%) will discontinue Phase 2b trials of its hepatitis drug, other hepatitis-related companies are seeing dramatic share movement. Rallying: VRTX +3.9%, ACHN +1.4%. Declining: INHX -27%, IDIX -13.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • DFS

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Discover Financial (DFS +3.4%) to Buy from Hold with a $29 target...

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Discover Financial (DFS +3.4%) to Buy from Hold with a $29 target price, saying FQ4 results are further evidence that DFS is outperforming its peers in the credit card industry with strong credit, spending and receivable growth trends. Stifel says the stock pullback is overdone and now presents an attractive entry point; Citigroup's analysis offers a different take.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival Corporation (NYSE:CCL) move up 1% premarket after nabbing an upgrade from...

    Shares of Carnival Corporation (NYSE:CCL) move up 1% premarket after nabbing an upgrade from HSBC to Overweight with a $38 price target. Analysts with the firm cite strong U.S. demand for the company's cruise vacations in taking its rating up a notch. Rival Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) didn't catch an upgrade, but shoots up 1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • ASNA

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) +9.5% premarket on a NY Post report that Ascena Retail Group...

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) +9.5% premarket on a NY Post report that Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA), owner of Dress Barn, "expressed interest" in buying CHRS. Ascena reportedly is not interested in owning Fashion Bug, and is mainly eyeing plus-size chain Lane Bryant. “They’re cleaning themselves up, dressing this lady up for sale," a source says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -5.2% premarket after the Beijing city government publishes rules requiring...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -5.2% premarket after the Beijing city government publishes rules requiring users of popular microblogging services in China to register their real names with service operators. Sina's popular Weibo microblog has become a gathering point for lively discussion and, on occasion, criticism of government policies.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • GILD

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) drops 3.6% after announcing it will "discontinue all treatment" in...

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) drops 3.6% after announcing it will "discontinue all treatment" in ongoing Phase 2b trials that involves use of its PSI-938 hepatitis drug. The company says it "detected laboratory abnormalities associated with liver function" in patients using PSI-938.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) gains 3.5% after the company announces it has been granted authorization by the...

    Molycorp (MCP) gains 3.5% after the company announces it has been granted authorization by the U.S. government to "commence exploratory drilling" at a rare earth deposit near its Mountain Pass, CA manufacturing facility. The company says it expects results from its drilling efforts in Q2 2012. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM

  • Delta Petroleum loses 24% in premarket trading after filing for bankruptcy due to its inability...

    Delta Petroleum loses 24% in premarket trading after filing for bankruptcy due to its inability to secure financing to repay debt. The company listed assets and liabilities in the range of $100M-$500M in a court filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • CVC

    Shares of Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) fall off 5.5% after the firm's COO abruptly left amid...

    Shares of Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) fall off 5.5% after the firm's COO abruptly left amid speculation another cable or satellite company could be interested in the exec. BofA's harsh two-grade downgrade on the company to Underperform from Buy also adds to the negative sentiment swirling about.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) offers $314M or $6.50/share in cash for ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) offers $314M or $6.50/share in cash for ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA +60%), a 67% premium to Thursday's close. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) updates the progress on its restructuring plans, saying it has completed a...

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) updates the progress on its restructuring plans, saying it has completed a private placement raising $285M for the newly created Frontline 2012. Frontline itself will own 8.8% of the new entity. Still negotiating with banks and counterparties, the company hopes to have a deal sealed by year's end, but cannot guarantee success. Shares -6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 AM

  • Will the ECB be carrying out QE on the sly with an ultra-long 3-year financing operation next...

    Will the ECB be carrying out QE on the sly with an ultra-long 3-year financing operation next week? One trader seems to think so, describing the manoeuvre as a "kind of like a QE backdoor." For traders, "It's like a no-brainer - you take the money at 1% and you buy Spain at 6-7%. That keeps supporting the periphery."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 AM

  • Spanish 10-year bond yields are off another 26 bps following yesterday's strong debt auction,...

    Spanish 10-year bond yields are off another 26 bps following yesterday's strong debt auction, and even with the overhanging threat of a mass S&P downgrade for the EU. Italian 10 year yields are down 17 bps. Banks are looking forward to Tuesday's loan tenders from the ECB, where they will be able to pledge their sovereign holdings as collateral for low interest 3 year loans.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 AM | 2 Comments
